definition: to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)

sentences.english: He was past sixty and had a long white beard curling down over his chest.
sentences.chinese: 他已年過六旬，銀白色蜷曲的長髯披掛胸前。

sentences.english: The dog uncoiled to its full length.
sentences.chinese: 狗把蜷曲的身體完全伸直。

sentences.english: Now you can fluff out the remaining cellophane above the curling ribbon.
sentences.chinese: 現在你可以出絨毛其餘玻璃紙以上蜷曲絲帶。

sentences.english: The acrobat could bend himself into a hoop.
sentences.chinese: 這個雜技演員可以把身體蜷曲成圈形。

sentences.english: She curled up in front of the fire with a book.
They then walked twice across the same sand surface while assuming a crouched stance.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他們以假設的蜷曲姿態兩次走過同一沙面。

sentences.english: The acrobat could bend himself into a hoop.
sentences.chinese: 這個雜技演員可以把身體蜷曲成圓形。

sentences.english: A doodlebug curls in his effort to get there.
sentences.chinese: 一隻獅蟻的幼蟲蜷曲着努力爬行。

sentences.english: Haven't you ever wanted to curl up inside a juicy hamburger?
sentences.chinese: 你難道沒有想過在一個美味的漢堡裏蜷曲起來嗎？

sentences.english: Curled up on a poncho , the floor for a bed?
sentences.chinese: 蜷曲睡在斗篷中，用地板作爲牀鋪。

sentences.english: He clasps the crag with crooked hands.
sentences.chinese: 他緊握巉巖石用蜷曲的手。

sentences.english: He was handsome in a way with curly hair and pink-and-white cheeks.
sentences.chinese: 長得也算英俊，蜷曲的頭髮，兩頰白裏透紅。

sentences.english: The small boy twisted further into himself.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩子蜷曲着身體縮作一團。

definition: to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)
to curl up/to lie with knees drawn up/to huddle up
the four limbs of the body
to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
to curl up/to lie curled up
